nodes.text: Maygo, known also as Plug-Eye Maygo, was an individual who at one point carried out a transaction involving an SX-21 pump-action scatter blaster with the criminal Sana Starros. At some point between 10 BBY and 3 ABY, Starros came into possession the book that would become known as the Smuggler's Guide and found within a valuation of an SX-21 by the arms dealer Ephant Mon that valued the weapon at 2250 credits. She circled the name of the weapon and left a note claiming that she had known that Maygo was ripping her off.

Maygo was first mentioned in the new Star Wars canon in the 2018 reference book Star Wars: Smuggler's Guide, which was written by Daniel Wallace. The character originated in the Star Wars Legends continuity, where he first appeared in the 2002 article Race for the Tessent, which was written by Wallace, Jason Fry and Craig Robert Carey with illustrations by Ramón Pérez and published in Star Wars Gamer 9.
